task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 2°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: The current pitch is 0°, so the camera is level; to see the top of the building for height estimation, I need to look upward to capture the full vertical extent.
To estimate the building's height, I need to see both the base and the top; currently pitched up at 30°, I should look down to capture the ground level for a full vertical reference.

The building spans from the ground (visible at 30° down) to the roof (previously visible at 30° up), creating a 60° vertical angle; assuming a 10m distance to the building, height ≈ 10 * tan(60°) ≈ 17.3m.
